FuncDef:
The peer reflect-client command specifies the IP address of a client on an iNOF reflector.
The undo peer reflect-client command deletes the IP address of a client from an iNOF reflector. The peer reflect-client command specifies the IP address of a client on an iNOF reflector. The undo peer reflect-client command deletes the IP address of a client from an iNOF reflector. By default, no client IP address is specified on an iNOF reflector. This command is supported only on the CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P and CE8850-HAM.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a client.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the IPv6 address of a client.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: You can run this command to specify the IP address of a client on an iNOF reflector. In this way, iNOF packets containing the zone management configuration can be transmitted between the iNOF reflector and client.
